Description: Terracotta brazier fragment; mould-made; arch on a raised panel; bearded head in relief; Silenos mask; beard projected at right angles, but has been lost.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: J A R Munro
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Salamis (Cyprus), Site A (Site of the Granite Columns)
Curator's comments: Possibly the 'grotesque little head from a brazier' found at Site A and compared by the excavators (p. 122) with examples in Conze's group iii, A whcih are similar (Conze 1891, 126 and illustrations on p. 127). For stratified examples from Paphos, see Hayes 1991, 75-77 and plate XVII passim (with additional references). Bibliography: Conze, A. 1890, Griechische Kohlenbecken, JDAI V, 118-141. Hayes J. 1991, Paphos III. The Hellenistic and Roman Pottery (Nicosia: Department of Antiquities).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (A449)
Munro and Tubbs 1891 / Excavations in Cyprus, 1890. Third season's work. Salamis (p. 123, C (1) (?))
